title: Very late locally recurrent chromophobe renal cell carcinoma: 15 years following radical nephrectomy for low-stage disease
patient: We were encountered with 57-year-old lady complaining of left dull aching loin pain. Examination revealed a palpable mass in the left loin. She gave a history of left RN 15 years ago, and pathology report showed T1b chromophobe RCC (chRCC) with negative resection margin. She was followed for 5 years before being discharged from oncological surveillance. Computed tomography (CT) of the abdomen and pelvis was requested and showed large (13 × 11 × 11 cm3) heterogeneous enhanced mass, occupying left renal bed (). CT of the chest was free of metastases. CT-guided biopsy was done, and pathology was favouring chRCC.\nThe patient was counselled, and surgery was successfully done through a generous chevron incision. shows the resected tumour. Final pathology confirmed the diagnosis of chRCC. The patient recovered well from surgery with no intraoperative or early postoperative significant complications.\nTo our best knowledge, this is the first case in literature, reporting a very late sole local huge recurrence of chRCC. Patient’s consent for publishing was obtained, and no identifier data were included in the study.
